title: [$125] Remove TestDrive from sign-up flow

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We currently have what's called a TestDrive that shows in various onboarding flows, right after the requisite, required information is provided (it differs on the onboarding intent. It looks like this. We'd like to remove this modal because: - We have a permanent training modal on Home, for new and existing users - This modal was always awkward, in that we close the required modal and then show this modal, which creates extra friction - We're making lots of changes to onboarding that focus more in immediate interaction with Concierge AI Product details for this issue: - Remove the "test drive" modal - Land the user on the relevant page, based on the onboarding intent. For most users this is going to be the Home page, but for some intents, we send them to the workspace editor directly at the moment. - We're not getting traction on the boss email input. Any other questions, let us know!
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @brunovjk
EXFY-18126

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.26-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82257 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsdoijsoidnjoisjdsoi@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.2 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Distance rates are enabled. - Workspace has two distance rates. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create a manual distance expense. 4. Open the expense. 5. Click More > Split > Save. 6. Open any split. 7. Click Report > Create report. 8. On the current report, click Submit and Approve. 9. Go to workspace settings > Distance rates. 10. Delete the distance rate used in Step 3. 11. Open the expense report containing split in the new report (from Step 7). 12. Click Amount. 13. Click on the highlighted row. 14. Click Rate > select other rate > Save. 15. Click Save. ## Expected Result: User should be able to save the split because user has changed the split rate to valid rate in Step 14. ## Actual Result: "Please fix the distance rate error" shows up, but user cannot edit the approved split (from 8). ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/73bb771e-86db-44fe-8e33-3592b1f0ad15 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: Bug

body:
Coming from here https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05S5EV2JTX/p1772035056144559 We are not currently doing anything if a booking has been canceled, so the user doesn't have the most up to date information shown. Problem: When clients cancel a booking, if they check their booking status in Expensify, then the status will be wrong and they will get confused. Solution: Start displaying the cancelled status

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.26-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176687/test-cases/41236700 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.7.4 Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: User A added User B as a copilot with limited access 1. As User A, create a workspace with submission frequency set to manual, enabled approvals and payments 2. As User A, add an expense in the workspace chat 3. Sign in as User B, switch to the User A's account 4. As User B, open expense details from step 2, click Submit 5. As User B, open More menu, click Retract 6. Observe the system message ## Expected Result: Limited copilot is not able to retract expense. When the copilot account retracts the expense, main account's avatar does not appear briefly above the "retracted" system message ## Actual Result: Limited copilot as able to retract the expense. When the full or limited copilot submits the expense, then retracts it, the system message appears with the main account avatar briefly ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b120274-e250-4718-b8ed-58e672e8aa69 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.26-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82432 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+dk10@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** iPhone 11/iOS26.3 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: - Use Expensifail account - Fresh install app or disable camera permission for Expensify in Settings 1. Open Native app 2. Tap on FAB > Track distance 3. Tap on Odometer tab 4. Tap on Thumbnail in 'Start reading' or 'End reading' 5. Tap on 'Continue' button 6. Tap on 'Don't allow' 7. On the new prompt, tap on 'Settings' 8. Enable Camera on the Settings page for Expensify 9. Navigate back to App, it should stay in Camera page 10. Capture the photo ## Expected Result: User is redirected back to Odometer page ## Actual Result: User is redirected back to Inbox page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7961f2e1-fac0-4de7-ac7f-359faf9e64be [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.26-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79530 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+ds@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Mac 14.5/ Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Go to a workspace chat 3. Create two expenses with the same amount (e.g., $10.00 each) 4. Open the expense report 5. Click "Review duplicates" in the header 6. Click on the first expense preview to open it > Click More → Delete → confirm deletion 7. Turn off network (airplane mode / disconnect) 8. Click the browser forward button once > you get: "Not Found" page 9. Click the browser forward button again ## Expected Result: "Not Found" page ## Actual Result: Infinite loading ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e31545ef-28e2-467e-a035-ca127aa7af59 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
